ratings.comment: Entertaining man.

Easy A if you have prior experience with calc.  Don't even bother going to lecture until before the midterms... Make sure you look at past midterms/exams because they are almost identical.  You learn everything from your TA so make sure you have a good one!

Wainger is knowledgeable and covers things well for people with prior calc experience, like me, so it was an easy A. for everyone else, your TA is your true professor, because you'll learn everything from them.  from Wainger, do ALL the practice tests he gives you, because they are NO DIFFERENT than the 2 midterms and final he gives.

Old man isn't very good at teaching. This class is about your TA, so make sure you get a good one or else drop it. He gives lots of old exams/tests which are good to study with, so make good use of them. He's an eccentric old man who stumbles around so much you think he's wasted/baked. Friendly and generous about grades, etc., but useless.
Go to lecture because he explains everything that will be on the test.  Easy tests but not good at explaining the material.
Funny but fairly old and clueless. On the flip side, his exams are easy (he tells you what will be on them). Don't expect to get much out of lecture--your TA will be your best friend.
Lectures are hilarious, but he lays out how he wants things on tests.  Depend on your TA to understand things, but try Waingers examples on your own.  Easy class.  I recommend taking it with him.

THIS CLASS IS SO EASY. i really don't see how you anyone could get less than an AB. The mode on the first midterm was a 100%, like seriously? sure, he sucks at teaching but the TAs can make up for it, and the material is easy anyways. definitely take this class with him. he's pretty funny as well, i feel like he's my long lost grandpa.
He is a not a very good teacher but he told us exactly what would be on the exams which was really nice! My TA was amazing and that was very helpful

Believe me when I say this: You better have yourself an amazing T.A.  I find that professor Wainger thinks that he may be teaching to the class, when in reality, he isn't. He's old and aloof. Sure, he's somewhat funny.. but he is unorganized and does not know how to teach. As for easiness of tests.. not bad! Pretty simple if you study.

If you're taking calc, take wainger. Great class. Don't bother going to his lecture unless you're looking for a few laughs. Go to the lecture before the exam and he will tell you exactly what problems are on the exams (obviously not with the same numbers). His tests are very easy.
He is probably the worst math teach I've ever had.  Just repeats himself when people ask him questions so no one ends up understanding and needs to retire ASAP!

He's hilarious. He's pretty damn old and not a very good teacher, but as long as you have a good TA you should be okay. He also usually lets you know what to expect on the exam. His lectures can get boring, especially when he makes mistakes and repeats himself a lot, but overall it's not that bad. Really. One funny old man.

Awful teacher. He really wants his students to learn the material, but he simply can't teach...at all. He routinely makes mistakes without correcting them, never explains anything conceptually, calls students out for looking at their notebook and writing instead of watching the board. Messed up grading both my midterms by over a whole grade (final?

Was long winded, repeated himself 16 times while writing the same things on the board. Went to office hours once, he told me because I needed help that I should drop the class, no partial credit on tests and you can't tell where the points are given or taken off. Avoid at all costs.

Would not recommend, your TA is your only savior. Lectures are not helpful, his handwriting is illegible and his lectures are boring and consist of showing examples. Assumes you already know everything and doesn't bother to explain theorems or equations. Great guy but he should retire, you can't help but worry that he might drop dead in class...
very easily understood

I never rate teachers, but I'm signing up for classes and was looking up another professor and saw that Prof Wainger had a bad review. I couldn't believe it, I thought he was great. Lecture was hilarious. His study guides were pretty straight forward so there weren't any surprises on the tests. I would highly recommend him!!
This is the funniest prof. i have ever had.  He will make you laugh in every class period.  He is a little random, but if you get what he is saying you will love him.

Don't listen to these Math 210 students. Prof. Wainger is VERY good as long as you work hard and pay attention. You can't just passively learn this material, which is what I think these people expect out of a Prof. He ALWAYS had time for his students and took a lot of time of his schedule to accommodate his honors kids. I recommend him highly

This class was the bain of my existence. Worst professor. His lectures were incomprehensible, without structure, and he a ridiculous amount of mistakes in problems during lecture. The material isn't interesting, and he can't explain it. Do practice tests and try and get a good TA because homework and lecture are pointless

I hated every minute of this class.He takes off points in tests for the stupidest things.He is a terrible teacher who makes multiple mistakes in every problem he does.He wastes class time and office hours.I went to get help and he could/would not answer my questions.He does not use email and is socially handicapt.Aviod this teacher!!!!

I LOVED this professor.  He is so old and ridiculous you have to love him.  Even to the very final class he would ask "Have you been to my class before?"  Exams are STRAIGHT off of the practice exams, you dont need the book at all.  Hes older, and a little out there, but overall an amazing professor, would definitely take another class with him.

While many of Wainger's lectures are pointless, dry, & aside from the fact that I've never seen a teacher make so many errors,  he isn't the horrible man some have been making him out to be. He is extremely goofy, there's no quizzes, & he hands out practice exams before tests. Just do the practice exams & go to lecture near tests & you'll be fine.

Waigner is a terrible prof.I hated going to class and hated this guy in general as a person.I went in for help numerous times and he is a jerk.He wastes alot of time in lecture and will put things on the exam that you have never seen in lecture or in the homework.Do yourself a favor and take this class with a different teacher.

He is a really good professor. His lectures are easy to follow but he sometimes makes silly mistakes. He is really funny and when he talks to the class it's histerical. The exams are easy and based off of the practice exams. The discussions aren't mandatory and neither is the homework. Your grade is based off of 3 tests and your final.

He really isn't that great of a professor--he tends to make a lot of mistakes while doing examples in class. The material may be hard to grasp the way he explains it. However, study the practice exams: they are exactly like the exams! And go to lecture the day before the exam because he goes over the practice exam, which is really all hes good for.

Avoid going to lecture at all costs.Only go the class before the exam do practice problems and the old tests.I learned everything I know from my TA.He will point you out in class to ask if you understand and will ask you again after you say yes.He threatens to take off credit for the stupidest reasons.Do yourself a favor and stay away from this guy

I hate Prof Waigner.He is a terrible teacher who cares more about insignificant details than actually teaching any sort of concept.  He repeats worthless crap ten times in 5 minutes and takes an entire lecture to get through 2 problems that could be done by anyone else in 10 minutes. He is a worthless prof who should not be teaching at UW.

Wainger is the worst professor I have ever had.  More than once, he has literally laughed at kids for not understanding what he's teaching.  He is terrible at explaining things and the book is even worse.  He has admitted in class that he can't explain some things because he just understands them and can't explain why.

Material in this class is really easy, you just have to learn how the prof wants you to do problems, you must follow his methods. There is very little actual math, and concepts are clear, you should go to lecture even though he is boring and old. Exams are almost identical to practice ones, there are specific types of problems he expects you to do.

Best math class I have ever taken so far.  The exams are based right off of the practice exams that he hands out.  The textbook is not needed. Go to lecture or discussion.  The lectures are boring and he is hard to hear, but he is an amazing professor.

This class is pretty easy. Go to lecture, do the practice tests, and your golden. It can be kind of a boring class, but its easier than other professors. Plus sometimes hes funny, well not actually, but he laughs so then i laugh. Don't take if your gonna jack around the whole lecture cuz he will call you out.
Hilarious to watch... explains things in a manner which coincides closely with his appearance--very disheveled.
Tool him in 1977. Does he still walk to the edge of the stage in the front of the lecture hall with his eyes closed and then turn and pace back to the board just when you think he might fall off?
Easiest math class I have ever taken. Exams are EXACTLY like the practice ones. He spends at least 3 lectures before the exams reviewing so you don't have to study much yourself. Very easy A.

Terrible teacher.  Extremely boring, lives in the 18th century, and teaches impractical material in the most boring fashion ever.  Take a different teacher if you have the chance.  Also, don't bother buying the book if you have him.  Save the $90 and just go to lecture and do practice tests.

Tests are based off of lecture, not book.  Better off grade-wise if you go to lectures.  Lectures are incredibly boring and he makes lots of mistakes on the board and tends to repeat things a few too many times.  Does take a very slow pace....which is always nice.  Sidenote: wore a max of three different outfits the entire semester!!

He does teach like we are dumb, which is somewhat helpful at 8:50am, but he does make mistakes ALL THE TIME. Which can keep you sharp or be really really annoying. He gives practice tests that are almost identical to the actual test. Doesn't follow the book much, go to lecture.

I LOVE him.  He's hilarious and he teaches like we're all dumb and repeats a lot and it helps us study a lot.  He's not the most interesting professor, but then again, since when was math interesting?!  Definitely take this class!
Very poor teacher. Disorganized, incoherent, cantankerous, unhelpful. Probably one of the worst tenured professors in the Big 10.
He's a crazy guy. It's funny to see the stupid things he does. He makes a lot of mistakes. The exams are easy, though.
Horrible!  Not helpful, been blown off before.  He's getting old and repetitive.
No Comments
No Comments
The worst professor I had in my four years of college.  He made absolutely no sense.  Doesn't teach out of the book so don't bother buying it.
he's crazy...i like that
hes crazy, however extremely easy, exams are very similar to practice tests given to you in class and info is not very hard, he does though make it much harder since he rarely makes sense of it

class is much more about what he is trying to say than the actual information. material is very easy and tests are not difficult, although usually only 5 questions. if you show up to class all semester you will hear/see 30 totally off the wall things from this man

I'm pretty sure he's clinically insane. He rambles on during class, and once he spent 45 minutes during a review day before an exam doing the problem the wrong way. Then, he just suggested not doing it his way. GREAT TEACHING...RNT.

He is exteremely confusing, which is hard to believe b/c the information is so simple. Often screws up his examples. Do the practice tests and homework out of the book, lecture is pointless. An easy A if you do that.
Not a particularly good teacher. Lectures are incredibly boring and sometimes confusing. Review sessions before tests often become useless as he goes off on pointless tangents.
Don't take this class unless required, its not very hard, but the professor although very nice and knowledgeable is a little out of touch.
really easy professor.  the way he taught things were really easy and definitely do your homework and study the practice exams he gives.

Definitely an entertaining? class.  I seriously went to class everyday wondering if he was gonna keel over.  the tests arent super hard, but the class is kinda pointless.  dont take it if u dont need to.
If you just do the practice tests you should be fine.  I was able to take my D at midterm and come out with a final grade of a B by just studying them for the third midterm and the final.

wainger was "off the richter.. off the richter... off ther richter" how can you people say he is a poor prof???? you should be ashamed!! we went to his class 5 times total for the whole semester and got A's!!!!!! AMAZING PROFESSO

Hmm... as long as he doesn't fall over and can handle the chalkboards - I'd say he'll stay kickin' for a few more years!  His office hours are useless, but the practice exams are almost identical to the real midterms, use them attendance is a good idea!

Although lecture is a bit boring, he is very cute to watch.  I personally loved this class.  I felt like you wouldn't have to go at all as long as you did the practice tests.  It is one of the easiest math classes I have ever taken.
avoid this class if possible
terrible, the class and the prof.

Don't take a high-level math course with him.  He makes frequent mistakes, has trouble remembering most of the material, and thinks his way is the only right way.  His grading is brutal (almost no partial credit) and he's pretty rude to most students.
No Comments

*WARNING, WARNING*: Go to class, pay attention, use practice exams. I never had received A's in math before, and I aced every test in this class! I don't know how helpful he is in office hours because I never went.

In theory I should have gotten a high A,but this teacher is so picky about how you write out your answers that I got a B. Lectures are annoying, people actually walk out of them. Practice exams help you on tests.
Stupid teacher, this class sucks                                                   Go to class and do the practice exams!!!

Although he may be slightly boring, the tests are easy. People who don't go to class don't do well, so you have to go to class. If you can look past his quirks, you will be fine because he teaches things in a straight forward kind of way.
The tests are exactly like the practice tests.  Very easy but a lot of points off for stupid mistakes.  He is painful to listen to though..I stopped going to class a while ago

He is very entertaining to watch--but extremely boring.  His tests are VERY similar to the practice tests, and sometimes it is even surprising that he is still teaching or that he is even your teacher.
terrible class and awful professor
Prof. Waiger is very difficult to understand, doesn't use email nor computer equipment, and teaches completely different methods than the text uses.
He's old and entertaining, and the exams are the exact same as the practice tests he gives.
He Sucks
No Comments
